001package imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.guibas;
002
003import java.util.ArrayList;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005import java.util.Collection;
006import java.util.Collections;
007import java.util.LinkedList;
008import java.util.List;
009
010import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
011import imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.DelaunayTriangulation;
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.Triangle;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.Utils;
014
015
016/*******************************************************************************
017 * This software is provided as a supplement to the authors' textbooks on digital
018 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.
019 * Permission to use and distribute this software is granted under the BSD 2-Clause 
020 * "Simplified" License (see http://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-2-Clause). 
021 * Copyright (c) 2006-2022 Wilhelm Burger, Mark J. Burge. 
022 * All rights reserved. Visit http://www.imagingbook.com for additional details.
023 *******************************************************************************/
024public class TriangulationGuibas implements DelaunayTriangulation {
025
026        private final List<Vector2D> points;
027        private final List<Triangle2D> triangles;
028        private final Triangle2D outerTriangle;
029
030        /**
031         * Constructor. 
032         * @param pointSet the point set to be triangulated
033         * @param shuffle set {@code true} to randomly shuffle the input points
034         */
035        public TriangulationGuibas(List<? extends Pnt2d> pointSet, boolean shuffle) {
036                if (pointSet == null || pointSet.size() < 3) {
037                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Point set must contain at least 3 points.");
038                }
039                this.points = makePointset(pointSet, shuffle);
040                this.triangles = new ArrayList<>();
041                this.outerTriangle = new Triangle2D(Utils.makeOuterTriangle(pointSet));
042                triangulate();
043        }
044        
045        /**
046         * The simplest constructor. The supplied points will be inserted
047         * in their original order (without shuffling).
048         * @param pointSet the point set to be triangulated
049         */
050        public TriangulationGuibas(List<? extends Pnt2d> pointSet) {
051                this(pointSet, false);
052        }
053        
054        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
055        
056        /** 
057         * Converts the incoming points (of unknown type but implementing the {@link Pnt2d} interface)
058         * to instances of the local implementation ({@link Vector2D}).
059         * 
060         * @param inPoints the input points (must implement {@link Pnt2d})
061         * @param shuffle if {@code true}, the input point sequence is randomly permuted
062         * @return the new point sequence
063         */
064        private List<Vector2D> makePointset(Collection<? extends Pnt2d> inPoints, boolean shuffle) {
065                Vector2D[] outPoints = new Vector2D[inPoints.size()];
066                int i = 0;
067                for (Pnt2d ip : inPoints) {
068                        outPoints[i] = new Vector2D(ip);
069                        i++;
070                }
071                List<Vector2D> outList = Arrays.asList(outPoints);
072                if (shuffle) {
073                        Collections.shuffle(outList);   // random permutation of pointset (in-place)
074                }
075                return outList;
076        }
077
078        private void triangulate() {
079                triangles.add(outerTriangle);
080                
081                for (Vector2D pnt : points) {
082
083                        Triangle2D triangle = this.findContainingTriangle(pnt);
084
085                        if (triangle == null) { // pnt is outside of any triangle
086                                /* If no containing triangle exists, then the vertex is not inside a triangle
087                                 * (this can also happen due to numerical errors) and lies on an edge. In order
088                                 * to find this edge we search all edges of the triangle soup and select the one
089                                 * which is nearest to the point we try to add. This edge is removed and four
090                                 * new edges are added.
091                                 */
092                                Edge2D edge = this.findNearestEdge(pnt);
093
094                                Triangle2D tr1 = this.findOneTriangleSharing(edge);
095                                Triangle2D tr2 = this.findNeighbour(tr1, edge);
096
097                                Vector2D noneEdgeVertex1 = tr1.getOppositeVertex(edge);
098                                Vector2D noneEdgeVertex2 = tr2.getOppositeVertex(edge);
099
100                                triangles.remove(tr1);
101                                triangles.remove(tr2);
102
103                                Triangle2D triangle1 = new Triangle2D(edge.a, noneEdgeVertex1, pnt);
104                                Triangle2D triangle2 = new Triangle2D(edge.b, noneEdgeVertex1, pnt);
105                                Triangle2D triangle3 = new Triangle2D(edge.a, noneEdgeVertex2, pnt);
106                                Triangle2D triangle4 = new Triangle2D(edge.b, noneEdgeVertex2, pnt);
107
108                                triangles.add(triangle1);
109                                triangles.add(triangle2);
110                                triangles.add(triangle3);
111                                triangles.add(triangle4);
112
113
114                                legalizeEdge(triangle1, new Edge2D(edge.a, noneEdgeVertex1), pnt);
115                                legalizeEdge(triangle2, new Edge2D(edge.b, noneEdgeVertex1), pnt);
116                                legalizeEdge(triangle3, new Edge2D(edge.a, noneEdgeVertex2), pnt);
117                                legalizeEdge(triangle4, new Edge2D(edge.b, noneEdgeVertex2), pnt);
118                        } 
119                        else { // pnt is inside the triangle <a,b,c>.
120                                Vector2D a = triangle.a;
121                                Vector2D b = triangle.b;
122                                Vector2D c = triangle.c;
123
124                                triangles.remove(triangle);
125
126                                Triangle2D triangle1 = new Triangle2D(a, b, pnt);
127                                Triangle2D triangle2 = new Triangle2D(b, c, pnt);
128                                Triangle2D triangle3 = new Triangle2D(c, a, pnt);
129
130                                triangles.add(triangle1);
131                                triangles.add(triangle2);
132                                triangles.add(triangle3);
133
134                                legalizeEdge(triangle1, new Edge2D(a, b), pnt);
135                                legalizeEdge(triangle2, new Edge2D(b, c), pnt);
136                                legalizeEdge(triangle3, new Edge2D(c, a), pnt);
137                        }
138                }
139
140                // Remove all triangles containing any vertex of the super triangle:
141                this.removeTrianglesUsing(outerTriangle.a);
142                this.removeTrianglesUsing(outerTriangle.b);
143                this.removeTrianglesUsing(outerTriangle.c);
144        }
145
146        /**
147         * This method legalizes edges by recursively flipping all illegal edges.
148         * 
149         * @param triangle  the triangle
150         * @param edge      the edge to be legalized
151         * @param newVertex the new vertex
152         */
153        private void legalizeEdge(Triangle2D triangle, Edge2D edge, Vector2D newVertex) {
154                Triangle2D neighbourTriangle = this.findNeighbour(triangle, edge);
155                // If the triangle has a neighbor, then legalize the edge
156                if (neighbourTriangle != null) {
157                        if (neighbourTriangle.isPointInCircumCircle(newVertex)) {
158                                triangles.remove(triangle);
159                                triangles.remove(neighbourTriangle);
160
161                                Vector2D noneEdgeVertex = neighbourTriangle.getOppositeVertex(edge);
162
163                                Triangle2D triangle1 = new Triangle2D(noneEdgeVertex, edge.a, newVertex);
164                                Triangle2D triangle2 = new Triangle2D(noneEdgeVertex, edge.b, newVertex);
165
166                                triangles.add(triangle1);
167                                triangles.add(triangle2);
168
169                                legalizeEdge(triangle1, new Edge2D(noneEdgeVertex, edge.a), newVertex);
170                                legalizeEdge(triangle2, new Edge2D(noneEdgeVertex, edge.b), newVertex);
171                        }
172                }
173        }
174
175        /**
176         * Returns the point set in form of a vector of 2D vectors.
177         * 
178         * @return Returns the points set.
179         */
180        public List<Vector2D> getPointSet() {
181                return points;
182        }
183
184        /**
185         * Returns the triangles of the triangulation in form of a vector of 2D
186         * triangles. The initial 'superTriangle' is removed.
187         * The resulting triangles should form a convex structure.
188         * 
189         * @return the triangles of this triangulation.
190         */
191        @Override
192        public List<Triangle> getTriangles() {
193                return Collections.unmodifiableList(triangles);
194        }
195
196        @Override
197        public List<Pnt2d> getPoints() {
198                return Collections.unmodifiableList(points);
199        }
200        
201        // triangle-related methods ---------------------------
202
203        /**
204         * Returns the triangle that contains the specified point or null if no
205         * such triangle exists.
206         * @param point the query point
207         * @return the containing triangle or {@code null} if none was found
208         */
209        public Triangle2D findContainingTriangle(Vector2D point) {
210                for (Triangle2D triangle : triangles) {
211                        if (triangle.containsPoint(point)) {
212                                return triangle;
213                        }
214                }
215                return null;
216        }
217
218        /**
219         * Returns the neighboring triangle of the specified triangle sharing the same edge
220         * as specified. If no neighbor sharing the same edge exists {@code null} is returned.
221         * TODO: searching over ALL triangles seems to be unnecessarily expensive
222         * 
223         * @param tri1 the triangle
224         * @param edge the edge
225         * @return the triangle's neighboring triangle sharing the same edge or {@code null} if no
226         *         such triangle exists
227         */
228        public Triangle2D findNeighbour(Triangle2D tri1, Edge2D edge) {
229                for (Triangle2D tri2 : triangles) {
230                        if (tri2.containsEdge(edge) && tri2 != tri1) {
231                                return tri2;
232                        }
233                }
234                return null;
235        }
236
237        /**
238         * Returns one of the possible triangles sharing the specified edge. Based on
239         * the ordering of the triangles in this triangle soup the returned triangle may
240         * differ. To find the other triangle that shares this edge use the
241         * {@code findNeighbour(Triangle2D triangle, Edge2D edge)} method.
242         * @param edge the edge
243         * @return the triangle that shares the specified edge or {@code null} if none exists
244         */
245        public Triangle2D findOneTriangleSharing(Edge2D edge) {
246                for (Triangle2D triangle : triangles) {
247                        if (triangle.containsEdge(edge)) {
248                                return triangle;
249                        }
250                }
251                return null;
252        }
253        
254        /**
255         * Returns the triangle edge nearest to the specified point.
256         * @param point the query point
257         * @return the triangle edge nearest to the specified point
258         */
259        private Edge2D findNearestEdge(Vector2D point) {
260                Edge2D minEdge = null;
261                double minDist = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
262                for (Triangle2D tri : triangles) {
263                        Edge2D.Distance ed = tri.findMinEdgeDistance(point);
264                        double dist = ed.getDistance();
265                        if (dist < minDist) {
266                                minDist = dist;
267                                minEdge = ed.getEdge();
268                        }
269                }
270                return minEdge;
271        }
272
273        /**
274         * Removes all triangles that contain the specified corner point.
275         * @param point the corner point
276         */
277        public void removeTrianglesUsing(Vector2D point) {
278                List<Triangle2D> trianglesToBeRemoved = new LinkedList<>();
279                for (Triangle2D triangle : triangles) {
280                        if (triangle.hasVertex(point)) {
281                                trianglesToBeRemoved.add(triangle);
282                        }
283                }
284                triangles.removeAll(trianglesToBeRemoved);
285        }
286
287}
